title: 108_hr2291
content: Loan forgiveness for Head Start teachers. The "Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003" allows Head Start teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive years to qualify for loan forgiveness. This applies to teachers in schools eligible for Perkins loan cancellation and Head Start teachers. Secondary school teachers must teach a subject relevant to their academic major. The "Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003" allows Head Start teachers to qualify for loan forgiveness after working full-time for 5 consecutive years. Teachers must demonstrate knowledge and teaching skills in relevant subjects, such as reading, writing, mathematics, and early childhood development. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003 allows individuals with a baccalaureate or graduate degree to qualify for loan forgiveness after working in Head Start programs for 5 years. Authorization of appropriations is provided for loan repayment for eligible service. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003 allows individuals with a baccalaureate or graduate degree to qualify for loan forgiveness after working in Head Start programs for 5 years. Teachers must have been employed for 5 consecutive years in a qualifying school to be eligible for loan cancellation. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003 requires teachers to demonstrate knowledge and teaching skills in specific areas of the curriculum to qualify for loan forgiveness after 5 years of employment in a qualifying school. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003 requires individuals to have a baccalaureate or graduate degree for loan forgiveness eligibility. Authorization of appropriations is provided for loan repayment for qualifying service. The Loan Forgiveness for Head Start Teachers Act of 2003 requires degree for loan forgiveness eligibility and authorizes appropriations for loan repayment.
